Capella star
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2000 Topics (Year Of The Phoenix): Capella star
By lovesaurian on Wednesday, October 18, 2000 - 03:44 pm:

I am sure all of us are familiar with Capella, a D class monster (jell/naga). Well, if any of us take astronomy class, you may know there is a star called capella. Inresting? does any one know how other monsters got thier names? because i am fairly sure that some the other names have some significat meaning.

By Nate Railsback on Saturday, October 21, 2000 - 01:04 pm:

Well, Antares and Celious (Sirius) are both stars, too.

Another question- replaying Chrono Trigger (after Chrono Cross) reminded me how Robo's real name is Prometheus. There's that Henger/Dragon in S-class also named Prometheus. Furthermore, the pure Henger looks A LOT like Robo, except it's much thinner and has only one eye. Could that Henger/Dragon be a nod from Tecmo to Square?

By *R* on Saturday, October 21, 2000 - 05:45 pm:

Celious = Sirius?
*smacks forehead*
That's almost as bad as the Alkanshel/Archangel goof in Xenogears, or heck, the Lawrence "Rivermore" Labs in Metal Gear Solid :P

Oh yeah, and it's not a "Mock," it's a "Moku." Moku is the Kanji for "wood." Another example is Mokujin (wood man) from the Tekken series.

*R*

By Nate Railsback on Monday, October 23, 2000 - 08:43 am:

Actually, I thought "Alkanshel" worked for that particular boss. Considering it was absolutely invincible until (*major spoiler*), having "shell" in the name works. And considering all the rest of the religious themes in that game, if it had meant Archangel, it probably would have said it.

By *R* on Monday, October 23, 2000 - 02:57 pm:

It was meant to be Archangel, according to the customer support people bugged about it (and several other issues) :P

*R*
